whatIs.title: What is VibeTrans English to Swahili Translator?
whatIs.description: The VibeTrans English to Swahili Translator is an AI-powered localization assistant built for fast, culturally-aware communication across East Africa. It keeps regional slang, honorifics, and tone consistent while handling docs, voice notes, and API requests. Businesses, NGOs, and creators rely on it to collaborate confidently with Swahili speakers in Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, and beyond.

howto.title: How to translate English to Swahili
howto.description: Follow these quick steps to convert English content into accurate Swahili copy.

steps.title: Gather Your Content
steps.description: Paste English sentences or upload .txt and .docx files. VibeTrans detects jargon, dates, and numbers automatically so you do not have to pre-format anything.

steps.title: Select Context
steps.description: Choose business, travel, education, or NGO mode to unlock domain-specific terminology packs tailored for East African partners and audiences.

steps.title: Translate with AI
steps.description: Click Translate to generate human-friendly Swahili text. Tone, slang, and formality shift automatically based on the mode you selected.

steps.title: Review & Export
steps.description: Listen with text-to-speech, copy to clipboard, or download a clean .txt file. Share directly with teammates so everyone aligns on approved Swahili wording.

items.title: Swahili's Arabic Connection
items.description: Did you know about 35% of Swahili words come from Arabic? This mix creates interesting challenges for translation tools. Especially when handling financial or religious texts, where Arabic loanwords are common.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Quick answers before you launch your next English to Swahili project

items.question: What is the best English to Swahili translator for business teams?
items.answer: VibeTrans combines AI with curated East African phrase banks, making it the best English to Swahili translator for sales, legal, and operations teams that need reliable tone control.

items.question: Can I translate documents and audio together?
items.answer: Yes. Upload text, Word files, or paste scripts, then generate Swahili copy, downloadable transcripts, and even text-to-speech audio for voice-over work.

items.question: Does this translator handle regional slang and idioms?
items.answer: Absolutely. Community feedback and domain glossaries help VibeTrans interpret slang like "shwari" or "pole sana" so your message lands naturally.

items.question: Can developers integrate this translator into existing tools?
items.answer: Yes. Use the REST API or webhook to push English to Swahili translations directly into apps, CRMs, or chat automation without manual copy-paste.

items.question: How is my translation data protected?
items.answer: All projects are encrypted at rest and in transit, with role-based access and optional data retention controls so only your team sees translations.

items.question: Can I use the translator offline?
items.answer: This translator is web-based only and requires an internet connection. It does not support offline usage or mobile apps. All translations happen online through our secure servers.
